content: jeweled cowl by knittimo size 14 wide 44 long circumference materials one skein of malabrigo yarn lace 50g/470yd 728 of size 8 round seed beads us 8 5 0mm circular needles 24 or 32 recommended us 14 0 75mm crochet hook stitch marker gauge approx 4 5 sts / 7 5 row = 1 in stockinette abbreviations st s = stitch es yo = yarn over skp = slip 1 knitwise knit 1 pass the slipped st over directions this cowl is knitted in the round and the beads are attached as you knit with a crochet hook if you are not familiar with the method please see some how-to videos available online cast on 200 sts join in the round place marker to mark the beginning of the round knit 1 round start knitting with sectional openwork lace and beads as follows to avoid the beginning side of openwork looking stretched i recommend you twist =knit through the back loop one stitch before doing/knitting the first yo every round sample shown worked w/o twist round 1 yo skp 15 times knit the rest around round 2 knit all putting a bead on every skp st except the last one 14 beads per round round 3 knit to the first beaded st work as round 1 repeat round 2-3 51 times more 14 x 52 = 728 beads in total openwork section moves to the left by 1 st every 2 rounds knit 1 round bind off all enjoy © 2011 sachiko uemura all rights reserved for personal and non-commercial use only
